title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Somalia Crisis Recovery Project (SCRP)

description.narrative:
The objective of the Technical Assistance for Somalia Crisis Recovery Project (SCRP) is for UNOPS to support the implementation of the Somalia Crisis Recovery Project (SCRP). The services provided by UNOPS will assist the Project Implementation Unit (PIU) of the Federal Ministry of Finance is able to manage the implementation of project activities in accordance with guidelines of the Federal and State Governments, the World Bank and within the stated operations procedures. This will include the start-up intensive technical advisory support/assistance at Federal Government of Somalia and Federal Member State levels for the first year of project implementation, to be phased out over a period of two years as the capacity of the PIU and Federal Member State Project Teams are established.
UNOPS supports the Federal SCRP PIU to manage and coordinate project preparation and implementation through the provision of timely and quality support to overall central oversight, coordination, M&E and project progress reporting functions as well as capacity enhancement.
Furthermore, UNOPS will support the PIU in the set-up and operations of the State Project Teams in the three flood-affected states of Hirshabelle, South West and Jubaland as well as relevant ministries, departments and agencies that are responsible to manage and implement activities under the Project. While the initial support will focus on the three flood-affected states, UNOPS will also support the PIU to advance a national approach to the locust response, longer-term resilience building and the contingency Emergency Response Component.
The United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS) will provide Technical Assistance and Project Management Support to the Project Implement Unit, covering four key Areas; 1. Implementation support, 2. Safeguard Compliance support, 3. Technical Studies & Design support, and 4. Monitoring & Evaluation and Reporting support.
